characters: IN THE BOTTOM OF THE PIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START TIGHT ON MARCUS WRIGHT. He's an intense, powerful m 20's-30's, his head shaven. Marcus stares INTO CAMERA wit resigned expression. We hear the voice of a PRIEST:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art beside me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK, straight up. MARCUS lies in his cot, staring at the ceiling. He's smoking a CIGARETTE. This OVERHEAD ANGLE reveals a PRIEST with a BIBLE, in a foldin chair beside him. A CHESS SET, stacks of BOOKS, WRITING MATERIALS in the cell. TWO GUARDS wait, shackles in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS has no interest in scripture. He blows a cloud of SMOKE which drifts in the direction of the PRIEST, who bl and shuts his bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the GUARDS unlocks the cell door for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. SERENA KOGAN. She's in her 30's-50's, brilliant, attractive, but thin and pale, a scarf tied around her he She carries a CLIPBOARD. The PRIEST backs off to give her some privacy with Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus-- I'm Doctor Serena Kogan, I'm with Project Angel. You consented to donate your body to science...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm pretty much done with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been chosen for our research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chosen?    Lucky me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need a couple of signatures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits up, she passes him the clipboard and pen-- he notes that her hands are SHAKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to be scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.    It's nerve degeneration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS looks up from the form, takes in the scarf coverin her sparse hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the only one with a death sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS meets her eyes.      She studies him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) What you're doing is important, Marcus. Our work is still highly experimental... but you may be helping people in ways you can't begin to imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a regular hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that sarcastic comment, he SIGNS HIS NAME-- we see t words "PROJECT ANGEL" at the top of DENSE TYPE on the for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA takes the clipboard, starts to rise.         She t hand for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.     And... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one lives forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUARD sees SERENA out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE - MARCUS' CHAINED ANKLES clank as the GUARDS le him down the corridor, past PRISONERS in their cells; som avert their eyes, others give a nod or raise a fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, this is your last opportunity to make a confession...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS stares straight ahead, taking deep, steady breaths struggling not to succumb to fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRIEST (V.O.) (cont'd) Is there nothing you would say to Officer Martinez' family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - BUCKLES TIGHTEN... AN ALCOHOL SWAB on MARCUS' FOREARM... A NEEDLE punctures his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say. I was seventeen, I was angry, I was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINGERS turn the VALVE to release the LETHAL CHEMICALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MARCUS' EYES, looking up toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DEADLY I.V., running into his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this, he looks toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS REFLECTION in a one-way mirror, the dim shapes of WITNESSES beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (V.O.) (cont'd) Yeah... I'm sorry about it. I'm sorry about everything. The whole goddamn world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the lethal injection takes hold, his POV moves to BRIG LIGHTS overhead, losing FOCUS and BLEACHING TO WHITE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the WHITE SCREEN, a FACE emerges, backlit, blurred-- it's SERENA. She's in focus for just a moment, leaning IN CAMERA-- then moves OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORNSTALKS as far as the eye can see, rustling in a summe breeze. FIGURES are moving within the FIELD. We only make them out in SILHOUETTE, but all carry HEAVY RIFLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COMPUTER TARGETING SCREEN - the FIGURES are HIGHLIGHTED this tactical display, as is an OCTAGONAL HATCH into the ground beneath the corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FIGURES in the corn look up-- we hear an AIRCRAFT APPROACH with a JET WHINE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FWOOM! A MASSIVE CONCUSSION as a BUNKER-BUSTING MISSILE BORES into the earth at high-velocity, burrowing deep--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --then a HUGE BLAST - FLAME and DIRT are thrown high in t air, many of the FIGURES blown sky-high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLAMING BODY hits the ground IN FG, FACE TO CAMERA... w now see it was a STEEL TERMINATOR-- its METAL SKULL BLOWN OPEN and SCORCHED, its RED EYES SHATTERED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-10 WARTHOGS-- stubby attack planes-- SCREAM from the sk RAKING THE REMAINING FIGURES with CANNON FIRE, BLASTING T to bits. These aircraft no longer bear traditional U.S. insignia-- they're painted in WILD COLORS, graffiti lette says things like: "BOT BLASTER," "KILL FOR CONNOR," "RAGE AGAINST THE MACHINES," etc... Resistance fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motley military and civilian CHOPPERS LAND in the CORNFIE disgorging RESISTANCE SOLDIERS. These are human troops in high-tech HELMETS, carrying slightly futuristic conventio ASSAULT WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WARTHOGS veer off, laying NAPALM in the distance behi the SOLDIERS. The troops run toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --AN OPENING which has been blown into the ground, the remains of the octagonal hatch where the bunker-buster hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surviving TERMINATOR rises from the SINGED CORN, FIRES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --DROPPING A SOLDIER. His comrades FIRE EXPLOSIVE BULLETS and BLOW THE ROBOT APART. The LEADER of this assault grou waves his soldiers to enter the dark hatchway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLLAPSED CEILINGS, FLAMES, a high-tech installation in ruins; RED LIGHTING, distinctive of Skynet environments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS flick on HELMET LAMPS and make their way careful inside-- pretty deserted. They kick aside rubble to enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELMET BEAMS play over BANKS OF ELECTRONICS and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a dozen fixed, INDUSTRIAL ROBOTS-- not remotely HUMANOI engaged in mysterious tasks, mechanical arms at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SOLDIERS rake the room with GUNFIRE-- MACHINERY collapses, SPARKS from EXPLODING CIRCUITRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deeper into the complex, A HEAVY DOOR BLOWS off its hinge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS move from cover and through the blown door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TUBES and FIBER-OPTIC CABLES run into DOZENS OF GLASS CYLINDERS filled with translucent PINK LIQUID. The SOLDIE make their way in, alert-- but nothing's moving in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TEAM LEADER peers into a cylinder, aims his HEADLAMP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A small MASS OF TISSUE floating inside, connected to a dense network of FIBER-OPTIC CABLES... it's a HUMAN BRAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TEAM LEADER recoils-- but before he can say more, the ROOM SHAKES with a DEAFENING ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge ESCAPE SHIP rises straight up from an open HATCHWA Nearby TROOPS crouch and FIRE after it. THE SHIP PIVOTS i mid-air and ROARS OFF, SOLDIERS dodging the ENGINE BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TEAM LEADER speaks into his headset. The OTHER SOLDIE inspect the many CYLINDERS, react in horror and shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not believe the shit we found down here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he speaks, CAMERA FINDS a GREEN LED on the ceiling-- w suddenly FLASHES RED and BLINKS RAPIDLY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE - AN IMMENSE SUBTERRANEAN BLAST causes a few hundred yards square to SWELL and then COLLAPSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JETS of FLAME, SMOKE and DIRT RISE in the aftermath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PANICKED PILOT on the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --repeat, that was not us! A ship escaped, they musta blown the place themselves! Jesus, a lot of our guys were still down there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS above ground help the WOUNDED to EVAC CHOPPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN FG, FIND the STEEL SKULL of the dead TERMINATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAME ANGLE-- the TERMINATOR now half-sunk in mud. A FIELD MOUSE has nested in its skull cavity, seeking shelter fro RAINDROPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Months have passed, the season changed-- CORN long dead, black stubble. RAIN falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PATCH OF MUD stirs-- something below is moving.       T roils, seeming to assume a HUMAN SHAPE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYES OPEN, looking around in shock, the naked FIGURE is s drenched in mud we can't recognize it at first. The figur rises, looks up at the sky, and FALLING RAIN washes away from his face... it's MARCUS WRIGHT. He opens his mouth, makes a few GUTTURAL NOISES... then SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS UP from MARCUS' AGONIZED FACE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARE FEET trudge through the dirt. MARCUS moves along a slight rise, wrapped in torn and filthy RAGS, mud caked o his body. Eerie silence. Reaching the edge of a rise, he sees in the distance--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DECIMATED CITY, buildings collapsed into rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOONLIGHT. THE SKELETON of a large DOG lies on the ground partially covered by a dusting of SNOW. It still bears a rotting COLLAR attached to a CHAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE to a CHAIN-LINK FENCE, partially collapsed, a singed faded sign: "BEWARE OF DOG."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER, we're in the low-rent district of this CITY IN RUI rubble, random walls still stand. Hulks of cars, rusted, windowless. It's been over a decade since the bombs fell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is the only thing alive here. He moves down this block, picks up a handful of SNOW, brings it to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COLLAPSED NEWSSTAND. MARCUS walks past the racks, picks a MAGAZINE which crumbles in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUMAN SKELETON, clothes in tatters, is half-buried behi the collapsed counter. There's a bulge in its shirt pocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS gingerly reaches into the pocket and fishes out a cellophane-wrapped PACK OF CIGARETTES and a butane LIGHTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS sits on a piece of rubble by the skeleton. He tear open the packet and puts a dried-out, stale cigarette to lips, tries the lighter a few times, finally gets a flame He lights the cig, inhales deeply-- he waits for a rush, feels nothing. He takes a few more drags, increasingly disappointed, then flicks the cigarette away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises, looks toward a caved-in STOREFRONT, makes out a clothing store's TATTERED SIGN on the ground, amidst brok glass: "SALE! GOING OUT OF BUSINESS! EVERYTHING MUST GO!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FALLEN RACKS, CLOTHES and SHOES covered in years of dust rubble. MARCUS, grateful to be rid of the rags, has pulle on jeans and sneakers, using the CIGARETTE LIGHTER for illumination. He kicks away some FALLEN CEILING TILES fro RACK OF ARMY JACKETS. He holds one up-- looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partially collapsed, a downscale watering hole. Broken stools, booths, a dead pinball machine. MARCUS, dressed n again using the LIGHTER to find his way, sorts through th broken glass and rubble behind the bar, comes up with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unscrews the cap, raises the bottle to a SKELETON on t floor nearby. Marcus takes a long pull-- and CHOKES, instantly dizzy. He sinks to the floor, passing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMORY MONTAGE: quick, fragmentary, impressionistic POVs, blurred, altered. SFX of HEARTBEATS, a RESPIRATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --WEBS of TUBES and FIBER-OPTICS FILLS THE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --GRIDS OF LASER LIGHT scan rapidly INTO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --DIGITAL DISPLAYS blink through murky LIQUID. SERENA mov INTO FRAME, a look of concentration on her face as she pe through the LIQUID, INTO CAMERA. She starts to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE SKY. TILT DOWN to find MARCUS, who plods on through dead city's outskirts. He pauses near a collapsed BUS KIO A SMILING WOMAN stares out at him from a faded ADVERTISEM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS studies the woman. She's nothing like Serena, but expression recalls the beckoning vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs his hand over the image of her face, pulls away a chunk of cracked, graffitied GLASS over the poster. Then carefully tears the poster to remove the woman's face, fo the paper, slips it in a pocket and continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted, CAR HULKS about, crumbling SKELETONS at the whe MARCUS moves down the center of the freeway on this MOONL NIGHT, paying little attention to anything around him. We in mostly flat, treeless plains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the opposite direction, FIGURES approach, moving thr the darkness. Marcus hurries excitedly toward them, the first living creatures he's seen. He waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Yo, over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIGURES pause, turning toward him in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Damn it's good to see you guys, I felt like I was the last man on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes in his tracks. These aren't humans. They're T- 400s-- PLASTIC-SKINNED TERMINATORS-- armed with PLASMA RIFLES. They wear a motley collection of found CLOTHING, their male humanoid faces are identical, unnatural and motionless, like masks. Their EYES FLICKER RED as they sc him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus backs away, runs.      The T-400s stare after him- don't fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE THROUGH BINOCULAR MASK - MARCUS running for all he' worth, heading toward the viewer. We hear a muttering VOI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey mister, where you goin' in such a hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A BOY, scrawny and filthy, in his early to mid teens. He crouches on the supports of a FREEWAY SIGN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears layers of TATTERED, OVER-SIZED CLOTHING.     He scrambles quickly down from the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT AN OFF-RAMP, Marcus' pace slows as he moves to get off freeway, when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY emerges from behind some RUBBLE, holding a HANDGU one hand, a lit OIL LANTERN in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOY (cont'd) Whoah, whoah-- hang on there.   Got any food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus raises his hands, shakes his head.     The boy loo over dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOY (cont'd) You look like you been eating pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy moves closer, puts down the LANTERN, frisks Marcu with one hand while holding the gun on him with the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're human... you can see me, you can touch me. This place is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY makes a dubious face, yanks a handful of PAPER SC from Marcus' pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) I thought I was in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises an eyebrow) This sure ain't heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things with masks, red eyes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terminators-- T-400s.   What is this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY unfolds the paper scraps in the LANTERN LIGHT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON PAPER SCRAPS - the WOMAN'S FACE from the poster, fragment of a MODEL'S PHOTO from a MAGAZINE AD, a paintin a FEMALE FACE from a PAPERBACK COVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY looks puzzled, intrigued by the pictures. But wit sudden speed, MARCUS GRABS THE BOY'S GUN HAND and wrenche hard-- it FIRES into the air. MARCUS gets control of the gun, wraps one arm around the boy's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm not in hell, where am I?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CHOKING) Texas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NOISE of a SHOTGUN PUMPING close behind MARCUS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS spins to face his attacker, pressing the handgun i the boy's cheek. He's face to face with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIRL, a couple of years younger than the BOY, training shotgun at Marcus' head-- she looks ready to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First put down the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GIRL shakes her head angrily.   She wears an aged, be BASEBALL CAP with a STAR on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill us both!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna kill anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Star. Put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head slightly, aiming carefully at Marcus' head, just a few feet away, a slight smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was only one bullet in that gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS hooks his foot around the oil lantern and deftly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --BOOTS IT at the GIRL. BURNING OIL spills across her leg she cries out and fumbles the shotgun. MARCUS tosses the at her, the two of them SPRAWL on the ground, the shotgun falling to one side--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS quickly snatches up the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using SNOW, the BOY helps the GIRL extinguish the flames her clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS stands over the kids with a gun in each hand.   He struggles to control anger, speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it when people point guns at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS quickly checks the chambers of both the shotgun an handgun-- indeed, both are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took on a guy like me with one bullet and an empty shotgun? (studies them admiringly) Pretty stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves the handgun in his belt, puts the shotgun down kneels to pick up fallen scraps of paper-- a few have cau FIRE and are incinerated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY and GIRL get to their feet, stare at Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have my gun back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS shrugs, gestures for her to pick it up.   He still looks at the PICTURES in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL (cont'd) Where'd you get those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps away from him) The city? Oh man. That place is red hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a small smile) Seemed kinda dead to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPOTLIGHT appears in the distance-- a ROVING HUNTER-KIL moving in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, automatically, the kids dive for cover behind a OF DEBRIS. MARCUS looks toward the LIGHT, unaware of dang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOY bolts from behind cover, grabs MARCUS by the arm-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOY (cont'd) Get down, they've seen the light!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags Marcus back behind the debris wall, just in time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the H-K nears, the LIGHT FINDS the BURNING OIL. It FIR BLUE PULSES, which CHEW up the asphalt nearby-- then it m on, failing to pick out the humans. Marcus is dumbfounded

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't a helicopter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an H-K-- hunter-killer.   Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rads musta fried his brains.   Let's go, Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The H-K has vanished in the distance. The girl rises.   T boy-- KYLE-- shakes his head, stays at Marcus' side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Marcus. Marcus Wright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle Reese. (indicates girl) She doesn't remember her name-- (re: her cap) --so I call her Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR gives Marcus a small, reluctant wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE (cont'd) Gonna be light soon, Marcus, better find cover. We spotted some buildings half a mile that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE points but gets no response. He shrugs, sets off wit Star in that direction. Kyle calls over his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE (cont'd) You can come if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing at him) Why? We don't need him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a shrug, sotto) I like him. He's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS looks around at the desolate world-- and the two t receding ahead of him. After a beat, he follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE, STAR and MARCUS move along the roadside, heading to dark BUILDINGS a few hundred yards off near an overpass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What year is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.   Eighteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.   Two thousand eighteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen years... I've lost 15 years. So who did it to us? Terrorists? The Russians, the Chinese--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nukes. There was a war, right? Who started it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE cocks his head at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something fall on your head? The machines did it, the computers-- they got smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judgment Day... I was just a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the last thing you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MEXICAN FAST FOOD JOINT, windows broken, sign collapsed near a two-story MOTEL with a COVERED CARPORT. The paveme is CRACKED, the structures WEATHERED, abandoned for a dec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS, KYLE and STAR suddenly rise from a hiding spot by DUMPSTER in a parking area. KYLE scans the FAST-FOOD PLAC with the binoculars, while STAR studies a WATCH she carri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyeball.   Only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drop down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE AEROSTAT patrols the area. It's a surveillance drone size of a softball, shiny steel, an inset camera lens wit RED GLOW. It flies in a geometric pattern, hovering every few seconds before continuing on. It vanishes around the corner of the fast-food joint, moving in the direction of motel. STAR has been timing its moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE and STAR dash for the fast-food entrance, MARCUS jus behind. They round the doorway and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --drop down inside behind an upended table in what was on taco place, remnants of Mexican decor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH A DIRTY WINDOW, they see the AEROSTAT buzz past, flying its pattern. It moves on without spotting them, th takes off in a new direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE and STAR set to searching the place, something they' done many times. They go through trash cans, check behind the counters and in the kitchen. MARCUS gets up, still looking out the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That flying grapefruit, what was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerostat-- one of Skynet's eyes. They patrol places like this, looking for survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's come up with some UNOPENED PACKETS OF CONDIMENTS fr bag of TRASH. KYLE trots over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any red ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods excitedly, hands him a packet.    He tears it op sucks down the contents eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE (cont'd) Mm.    Ketchup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR discards one packet, sucks at another-- and immediat makes a pained face and tosses the packet aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS picks up the packet, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JalapeГ±o sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR and KYLE pause in their eating, stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS shrugs modestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can I. (off Star's look) Well, sort of... a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With obvious reluctance, STAR holds a packet of mustard toward Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus gallantly waves it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.     Not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard anyone say that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE IN MIRROR - MARCUS stares at his own reflection in cracked MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR closes tattered curtains, plops on the bare bed, rea for sleep. The room's a mess, GRAFFITI here and there, tr scattered about; they're not the first squatters who've b here. THE GUNS and STAR'S WATCH lie on a dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE sits before the TV-- he's scratching STICK FIGURES o the screen with a rusted POCKETKNIFE. One is clearly mean to be him; the smaller one, wearing a baseball cap, is St

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever watch television?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Was about all I ever had to look forward to in the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a joint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prison. Spent half my life there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember TV a little.   Cartoons. It was great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE plops on the bed next to STAR, who's already out. MARCUS studies them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She your sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno. Been together since we was little. Bunch of us kids was at the day-care center when the bombs fell... she and me are the only ones still around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed; gestures around) So this is it? Your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna find the Resistance, fight for John Connor against Skynet. You oughta join us, you're pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're strong, you can read... you didn't kill us. Good enough for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skynet runs the machines...?   So who's this John Connor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's... I don't know. The best. Everybody talks about him. He's the one who's gonna save us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Him and Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Jesus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking the wrong guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closing his eyes) So why were you in prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) I killed a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were cops like terminators?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Nah, some of `em were all right. (SIGHS) My little brother Max, pretty wild kid, not much older than you-- he stole a car, just joy-riding, y'know, showing off.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Cop chased him right into our front yard, pulled him outta the car... and started whaling on him, kicking the shit out of him. No reason for it, Max was already in cuffs. I ran out of the house, guy tried to pull his gun on me-- guess I just went off on him. Don't even remember it really... they say I broke his neck. (BEAT) Max must be dead too, now... like everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS notices now that Kyle is asleep-- it's as if he's lulled him with a bedtime story. Marcus is oddly touched, pulls a cover over both the kids. KYLE starts, half-aslee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be here when I wake up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Stay away from the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So saying, KYLE falls back asleep. MARCUS sighs, moves through the room, quietly opens a drawer or two and finds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AFTERNOON LIGHT, MARCUS sits on the floor by a room door, shotgun leaned on the wall at his side. He has the bible open in his lap, head bowed over it. CLOSER-- his eyes ar closed, he's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR OPENS behind him, STAR peers out-- and looks relieved to see Marcus is still with them. As she takes a step toward him, he starts awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS relaxes, she sits down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR (cont'd) Whatcha reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bible. My grandma always tried to get me into it, but-- it always put me to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you read something to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS shrugs and nods, flips to a random page, squints a the text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori. Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son Jephunneh--"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a book inside with pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's already on her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - A PHONEBOOK, minutes later.    We hear MARCUS rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Guaranteed lowest prices... open seven days..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR sits at his side, looking over his shoulder as he tu pages. She points to something:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a flower. A rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full of wonder) So... all those numbers... you could call them and get, like, flowers, or someone to come over and fix stuff, or bring you food...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, touched) Guess people had it pretty good. (FLIPS) What else we got... movers, mufflers, music--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, pianos, guitars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You must... (approximating the tune) "I can't get no... satisfaction..." (off her blank look) "We are family... I got all my sisters with me..." No, huh. How about... "Twinkle twinkle little star..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star's face lights up, she nods eagerly, sings along:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS & STAR "How I wonder what you are... up above the world so high, like a diamond in the sky..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR is dizzy with emotion, wipes an eye, turning away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) Somebody used to sing that to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS puts the phonebook aside, puts a hand on her arm; she leans into him for a hug, tears forming in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR (cont'd) Stay with us, Marcus. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS looks down at her, affected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AEROSTAT POV - a PIXELLATED ELECTRONIC IMAGE as it patrol the MOTEL AREA in its geometric pattern. It ZOOMS into th CARPORT, quickly scanning the abandoned VEHICLES, among w is an aged, open JEEP WRANGLER, its HOOD UP, parked besid customized VAN. The cars are covered in DUST, the TIRES FLAT, they've been sitting here for a decade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBJECTIVE ANGLE - the AEROSTAT zips off on its rounds. Af a moment, the VAN DOOR slides open. MARCUS moves quickly back to the JEEP, KYLE and STAR behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR checks her WATCH while MARCUS goes back to work on t JEEP'S ENGINE. He's found some tools, already has removed and cleaned SPARK PLUGS, dismantled the DISTRIBUTOR. KYLE meanwhile, returns to INFLATING one of the tires with a BICYCLE PUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we get it to move, will you teach me to make it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called driving.   Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR wipes DIRT off the side of the VAN, revealing air- brushed ARTWORK beneath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   What were these like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS looks up from his work to see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHITE UNICORN in a FIELD OF FLOWERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SMILING) Not too many around in my time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AEROSTAT zips past the CARPORT.   As soon as its gone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JEEP is suddenly PUSHED from the carport, tires somew inflated. MARCUS is on one side of the rear, KYLE on the other, STAR behind the wheel, the seat moved all the way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get the vehicle to a slight SLOPE, it begins to roll its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop the clutch! Let your foot up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see it's been hot-wired. STAR has her foot all the way down on the clutch, now lets up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JEEP BUCKS and SPUTTERS... but CATCHES. As soon as it does, MUSIC BLARES from the tape deck-- raucous HEAVY MET the aged cassette SPEEDS and SLOWS. MARCUS runs for the driver's side, but the JEEP is pulling ahead fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR is staring at the speaker, mesmerized at the sound o the MUSIC. When she looks out the windshield--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --she's about to HIT A WALL, SQUEALS in terror--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MARCUS vaults in and pushes her aside, squeezing behind wheel, hitting the brakes and throwing the Jeep into neut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerostat's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE hops in back as MARCUS adjusts the seat and FLOORS I THE KIDS are exhilarated as MARCUS zooms out of there, heading off-road across the plains, LIGHTS OFF, MUSIC LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS turns the MUSIC DOWN.       He looks up to see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --THE AEROSTAT, right over their heads, keeping pace with vehicle, RED LIGHTS FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE rises in back, SWINGS at it with the SHOTGUN BUTT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AEROSTAT deftly dodges the blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! It's gonna call a Harvester, we're dead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS SLAMS on the brakes-- the AEROSTAT stops a few fee ahead of them, hovering in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS picks up an X-shaped LUG WRENCH from behind his se rises, taking aim--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and HURLS THE WRENCH with amazing speed and power--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it flies like a throwing star and SMASHES the AEROSTAT BITS in a shower of SPARKS and METAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them stare breathlessly for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   You're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS flexes his hand, startled at his own strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JEEP moves off-road, HEADLIGHTS OFF, traveling by MOONLIGHT. It SWERVES and BUCKS from time to time. MUSIC PLAYS from the TAPE DECK, something more melodic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE IN JEEP - KYLE behind the wheel, having the time of life, MARCUS supervising, STAR enjoying the breeze and th unfamiliar sensation of a moving vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!    You're doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SONG suddenly GARBLES, turning to NOISE. MARCUS eject the tape, pulls it out-- it's unspooled, tangled in the stereo's guts. THE KIDS groan disappointedly. STATIC from the radio now... but a FAINT VOICE audible beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Ssh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS FIDDLES with the dial. He can't get the SOUND clea rolls through the dial. Varying levels of STATIC, then a relatively CLEAR VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --proper ratio of ammonium nitrate to diesel fuel. A bomb of this type can be contained in an ordinary plastic garbage bag, and will detonate on impact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This recording has described booby- traps and explosive devices. It will repeat every two hours on different frequencies to avoid Skynet jamming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR points toward the horizon.    Marcus looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Other pedal, other pedal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SCREECH to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE DISTANCE - a RED GLOW of FLAMES far away. SILHOUET against this, strange FLYING VEHICLES and spindly, spider like MACHINES are just visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not give in to despair. As bleak as things seem, I assure you, humanity will triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE - THE JEEP turns away from the conflagration, moves off in a new direction and vanishes into the darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RADIO VOICE (cont'd) The machines only win when we give up hope... this is John Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE - a crumbling SERVICE STATION with a RUSTING TANKER on flat tires, the cab long gone.   MOVE TO FIND t JEEP approaching off-road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JEEP pulls to a stop, MARCUS gets out from behind the wheel and moves to the TANKER. STAR and KYLE, with his binocs, scan the area for signs of Skynet surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We oughta find a place to hole up for the day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS pounds on the TANKER-- a deep echo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it.    Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smell that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR sniffs the air herself, eyes going wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both hop out of the Jeep, running toward the GARAGE, each carrying their unloaded GUNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE - from BEHIND THE RUSTING SIGN, an AEROSTAT appears, aimed at the kids, LIGHTS BLINKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE and STAR slither under a partially open GARAGE DOOR. The space is dark, SMOKE-FILLED... STRIPS OF DRIED MEAT h from the hydraulic lift. The two youths look amazed and delighted. Kyle shoves the gun into his waistband, moves the closest strip and PEELS OFF A PIECE, takes a tentativ bite, then gnaws ravenously. Star leans the shotgun again the wall and follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS lifts the garage door and enters, DAWN LIGHT strea in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus squints at something in the darkness.   He takes a forward, then grabs Star's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CHEWING) It's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now KYLE reacts to what Marcus saw, GAGS and SPITS out me He's staring at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a dried, severed HUMAN HAND, resting on a GRILLE in the sunken SERVICE PIT, where a CHARCOAL FIRE smolders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star sees it too, turns and RETCHES, just as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --three animal-like CANNIBALS emerge from the back of the garage-- two burly, ugly, unshaven MEN and a wild-eyed, unhealthy-looking WOMAN with matted hair. We'll call them PIG, BULL and COW. PIG grabs the SHOTGUN, BULL grabs KYLE and yanks the HANDGUN from his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COW grabs STAR, shoves her into the center of the garage, beside Kyle and Bull. Bull tosses the handgun to COW who keeps it trained on the kids, sizing them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much meat on `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIG eyes Marcus, points the shotgun in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's fi-i-ine--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS raises two fingers like a peace sign-- then shoves them into the barrels of the shotgun. PIG snorts and PULL THE TRIGGER-- CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS yanks the gun away and tosses it aside, HEAD-BUTTS Pig, who staggers backward, BLOOD SPRAYING from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COW points the unloaded HANDGUN at Marcus-- CLICK CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE and STAR get free of BULL and dash for the exit, the out of there in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULL CHARGES MARCUS, who dodges him, grabs the man and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --HURLS HIM HEAD FIRST into the CHARCOAL PIT-- his BODY SIZZLES against the coals, he SCREAMS and WRITHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COW picks up an AXE with two hands and SWINGS it at MARCU who GRABS the HANDLE with one hand and YANKS it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COW knows she's met her match, turns and flees, heading o the way Kyle and Star went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS advances on PIG and BULL, brandishing the AXE. Pig squirms back across the floor, wiping BLOOD from his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't kill `em! I swear to God, they was dead already, we wasn't gonna let `em rot--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULL has scrambled out of the coal pit, but is in too muc pain to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go `head, take as much as you want, we're on the same side here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus looks ready to finish them off-- but reacts to CRI from outside, a loud MECHANICAL RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HARVESTER-- a GIANT INSECT-LIKE TERMINATOR-- is outside station. Many times the size of a human being, MULTIPLE A and LEGS sprout from its thorax, it has multiple CAMERA E on long, swiveling stalks-- it carries KYLE and STAR, the kids struggle frantically, caught in the harvester's join steel appendages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One unblinking EYE SCANS KYLE, another STAR; the harveste produces a NEEDLE from one of its arms, INJECTS the boy-- instantly goes limp, unconscious. It does the same to STA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As COW emerges--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --THE HARVESTER SPRINGS on her, with startling speed. She SCREAMS as the enormous terminator hoists her into the ai with the others, INJECTS her and begins moving toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A TRANSPORT. This consists of CONTAINER resembling a se trailer or wheeled dumpster, attached within a FRAMEWORK features movable ENGINE PODS and a mysterious ARMATURE at front. A STEEL LID in the top of the container OPENS hydraulically, the Harvester DEPOSITS the HUMAN CAPTIVES inside, and the LID SLAMS SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS has emerged from the garage, still carrying the AX He stays low, hidden behind the tanker, watching as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --PIG and BULL flee through a back entrance to the garage immediately attracting the attention of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the Harvester, which sets off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus comes to a decision.    He SPRINTS into the open, the TRANSPORT, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CLAMBERS up the side, hitting the thing at full speed, using an engine pod to boost himself higher. He's still short but swings the AXE and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hooks the AXE HEAD over the top of the container, like grappling hook. He pulls himself up and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --crawls across the roof, to the LID. There's a barred, reinforced MESH PANEL here, through which he can see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --about TWENTY HUMAN PRISONERS, unconscious on the steel floor. Among them are KYLE and STAR. Star MOANS, opens he eyes briefly and sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MARCUS' SILHOUETTE above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes flutter shut again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS struggles to raise the sealed lid, but there's no purchase available, just a smooth seam. Suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the TRANSPORT JERKS. MARCUS nearly loses his footing as the TRANSPORT STARTS ROLLING forward. He drops to his bel seeing that the transport is approaching--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the HARVESTER, which now carries PIG and BULL, both unconscious. THE LID OPENS and the Harvester DROPS the tw men INSIDE-- but its camera eyes fail to register Marcus, crouches behind the open lid. As the lid BEGINS TO CLOSE, the Harvester attaches to the armature at the front of th transport, making itself an aerodynamic part of the machi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS THRUSTS THE HEAD OF THE AXE under the closing LID order to prevent it from sealing. THE LID grinds against but remains ajar. A moment later--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --THE ENGINE PODS ROTATE DOWNWARD, FIRE and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --THE TRANSPORT LIFTS OFF THE GROUND. Within moments, the airborne dumpster has risen hundreds of feet in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS moves to the edge, looks down in astonishment at t fallow plains far below. Looking to the side, he sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A PAIR OF HUNTER KILLERS, swooping in quickly to provid escort for the slower moving transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND buffets Marcus, he hangs on for dear life. Clinging the top of the transport, he slowly makes his way back to the LID. As the transport BANKS, he almost loses his gras dangling for a moment before the craft rights itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS reaches under the jammed lid and pulls with all hi might. This thing is really heavy, plus he's fighting the WIND BLAST. MARCUS hears something behind him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HARVESTER has spotted him and is now prying itself lo from the armature. Also buffeted by the wind, it starts t move gingerly down the length of the transport toward Mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS must let the LID CLOSE. He snatches up the AXE, ta a couple of WHACKS at the thing, DENTING the metal, but d no serious damage. The Harvester KNOCKS the weapon out of his hand, Marcus has no choice but to keep backing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is driven to the back of the transport. Struggling for handholds, he lowers himself out of sight, down the framework along the side, getting out of the wind. Sudden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --STEEL CLAWS WRAP around him FROM BELOW, YANK him downwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HARVESTER has crawled around the SIDE of the TRANSPOR and under the BOTTOM, in order to GRAB HIM. The hideous machine now holds him in its clutches, hundreds of feet i the air, its CAMERA EYES fixed on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HARVESTER produces its needle, it's coming at his fac but MARCUS frees one hand, grabs the syringe, managing to hold it back, inches from his skin. His strength is weakening, but as the Harvester makes its final thrust--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he JERKS the NEEDLE to one side and it BENDS against on the Harvester's own steel limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undaunted, the creature crawls up the side of the transpo Marcus still in its clutches. It moves to the lid, which OPENS. It lets go of Marcus to drop him inside when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MARCUS seizes two of its appendages and swings up onto harvester's back, where he--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --GRABS a couple of EYE STALKS, trying to RIP them from t harvester's thorax, LOOSE WIRES SPARK. The Harvester twis and thrashes, it's like he's a rodeo rider. A LIMB wraps around him, starting to CRUSH him in a vise-like grip, wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CANNON FIRE RIPS through the towering HARVESTER, blowin its thorax to PIECES, barely MISSING MARCUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF A-10 WARTHOGS-- the same colorful ground attack aircraft we saw in the first battle-- ROAR PAST on either side of the transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CRIPPLED HARVESTER topples off the side of the transp still clutching MARCUS and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CATCHES on an ENGINE POD, the creature and Marcus both suspended in the air. THE HARVESTER ROASTS in the ENGINE BLAST, its CPU finally dies. Marcus is suspended below th engine, the steel limb RELEASES HIM, he has to cling to i now, to keep from falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HUNTER-KILLERS peel out in pursuit of the two Resista planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOGFIGHT ensues between the much larger, more heavily armored H-Ks, and the smaller, more maneuverable WARTHOGS CANNON FIRE CATCHES an H-K but has no effect. The H-Ks' B PLASMA PULSES barely miss the planes, which loop and bank

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AIR-TO-AIR MISSILE STREAKS from a WARTHOG and BLASTS t ENGINE of an H-K. AN EXPLOSION, the thing starts flying erratically, heading downward and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CRASHING to earth in a glorious FIREBALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT.   AERIAL & RIVER - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planes are nearing a RIVER, bordered by sickly TREES. the far banks, even from above, we see ominous MILITARY FORTIFICATIONS-- CONCRETE BUNKERS, ANTI-AIRCRAFT GUNS, et

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS meanwhile, is trying to climb up the dead Harveste avoid the ENGINE BLAST and find a handhold on the transpo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE A-10 that shot down the H-K comes around for another at the transport, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --ANTI-AIRCRAFT GUNS at the far side of the river let out VOLLEY of BLUE PLASMA-FIRE. The BURSTS arc toward the A-1 which swerves and climbs, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --PLASMA FIRE destroys a wing, the A-10 SPINS out of cont

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OTHER A-10 breaks off its dogfight with its H-K and speeds away from the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is tantalizingly close to the upper lip of the transport, he reaches out and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --THE FRIED HARVESTER suddenly dislodges from the ENGINE taking Marcus with it, into FREEFALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH MARCUS, plummeting downward toward earth, a hundred below, the transport continuing on its way above, crossin the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS' POV - the ground and treetops getting closer. At last moment, his continuing forward momentum takes him OV THE RIVER and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS and the DEAD HARVESTER HIT THE WATER, hard, vanish below the surface with enormous SPLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surviving H-K and the TRANSPORT continue across the r into Skynet territory, vanishing in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES to FIND a PARACHUTE, drifting earthward on t unfortified side of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD ON LAPPING WATER for a beat.      Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MARCUS breaks the surface, staggering toward shore, he drops to his knees in the shallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAKES APPEAR behind him. Hearing the water stir, Marcus turns to see numerous DARK SHAPES moving rapidly in on hi from different directions, FLASHES OF METAL visible benea the surface. These are HYDROBOTS-- AQUATIC TERMINATORS-- we don't get a good look at them (yet) and Marcus isn't sticking around. He scrambles for the riverbank and makes his way into the leafless trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS moves past the trunks of bare trees, pauses, looks over the water in the direction the transport took.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!   Up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR WILLIAMS, the helmeted pilot who ejected, hangs fro the tangled remains of her parachute, caught in the trees about fifteen feet in the air above Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS moves closer.    Blair struggles to saw through he lines with a KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) Who are you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LINES suddenly SNAP, Blair FALLS from the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus' reflexes are fast as ever, he's beneath her in an instant and CATCHES HER. He holds her in his arms:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can put me down now, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does so. Blair pulls off her helmet, her hair is short She's in her 20s, pretty, petite but strong, a no-nonsens battle-hardened member of the Resistance. She pulls a COMPASS from her flight suit, consults it briefly as she orients herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) I've got an ELT, but I can't call for a rescue here. There's an outpost a few miles upriver-- not my favorite people in the world, but it's safe. Let's move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair is already moving, Marcus hesitates, then points ac the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm heading that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a short laugh) The hot zone? No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get to my friends--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of kids. They were in that flying dumpster--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skynet transport? It was carrying people? (off his nod) Christ, we almost shot it down. There've been rumors about a concentration camp, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, gestures toward the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) You can't get across-- river's fulla hydrobots--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hydrobots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't see, but they have killer sonar. They'll attack anything that moves or makes a sound. Even if you get past them, you'd be dead before you covered a hundred yards. If the terminators don't get you, the fallout will-- heavy rads all the way to the Gulf coast, nothing can live there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus absorbs this, starts walking with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're with the Resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Blair Williams, I fly for what used to be the Air National Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a hand out, listening.   She signals for him to low, behind a fallen tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEARBY-- a pair of T-1s on patrol rumble into view. They pause, scanning the area, chain-guns at the ready. They start to move toward BLAIR and MARCUS' hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR quickly grabs a STONE and, staying down, hurls it a far away as she can--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE STONE strikes a few BRANCHES--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE T-1s suddenly turn in that direction, GUNS BLAZING--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WOODS in the immediate vicinity are torn to pieces by GUNFIRE, small FIRES erupt from the incendiary bullets-- definitely overkill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE T-1s roll over to inspect the damage, out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) Stupid bastards. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Marcus move away quickly, away from the trees. they're a safe distance from the robots--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... this has gotta be some kind of, like, dream or hallucination. Like what happens to people right before they die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair SLUGS him hard, in the arm.     He doesn't flinch, looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That snap you out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS shakes his head.   They keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) Well hell, maybe you are dreaming. Do us all a favor and wake up already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MOON over a scrubby forest, trees just a few feet hig BLAIR and MARCUS seem like giants as they move among them They've been talking a while, Blair's absorbing something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let me get this straight, Marcus. There you are on death row, they stick a needle in your arm...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) and the next thing you know, you're here. (off his nod) Since this ain't the resurrection, there's only one possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever they pumped into your veins just knocked you out. This Angel Project you signed up for-- there was a lotta cryogenic stuff going on before the bombs fell, they musta froze your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drug tests, medical experiments, organ harvesting, who knows? You said you had no family, no friends-- why let a body like yours go to waste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking him over as she says this, it almost sounds flirtatious. Marcus changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen trees like these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a mutation zone. I saw a two-headed squirrel here once--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tasted like chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR pauses, checking a small GEIGER COUNTER she carries it CLICKS a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) Levels are tolerable now, but just. We can't spend the night here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start moving again.   Marcus pauses, listens:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear anything--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they both hear an eerie HOWL, changing in pitch-- lik coyote on crack. More than one picks up the CHORUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) Skindogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a SIDEARM, holds it at the ready as she starts running, away from the direction of the noise. Marcus kee up at her side, looking behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't get a good look at them, but there's a pack of l BEASTS moving quickly through the undergrowth, gaining on fleeing humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR sees they won't outrun them. She spins, FIRES in th direction of the approaching PACK. Suddenly it's quiet-- animals fan out, forming a circle around Blair and Marcus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're surrounding us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS of MUTANT EYES, glowing in the dark-- ENLARGE TEETH-- DARK, MASSIVE FORMS moving through the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're smart. And they don't scare easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few tense beats, from the foliage--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SKINDOG leaps at BLAIR from behind-- it's hideous, the of a Great Dane, hairless, with veiny, wrinkled skin and long, catlike CLAWS. Before Blair can react, MARCUS leaps between her and the dog, grabs the slavering creature by throat. It SNAPS its ELONGATED TEETH at him, but he manag to BREAK its neck and hurl it toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MORE SKINDOGS moving in for an attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR FIRES a few SHOTS at the encroaching pack, we hear few YELPS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS protects her, effortlessly tosses a few more SKIND aside, ignoring vicious bites and scratches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other SKINDOGS turn on dead and injured pack members, begin TEARING INTO THEM. There's an opening now, the two humans make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR catches her breath, looking him over, seriously impressed by his strength and calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) You saved my ass. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS shrugs, turns back to see the feeding frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog eat dog world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's darker now, the moon is down. MARCUS and BLAIR move gingerly-- she TRIPS, he catches her before she falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR sighs, yawns, sits against a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) It's not far, but we'll never get across the mine field at night. Might as well STAF till morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS nods, sits a few feet away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) C'mere, it's cold. I don't bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS slides toward her, she nestles against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staf?   What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a resistance term.    Sit tight and fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon they're kissing passionately.      But MARCUS pulls rolls onto his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) You holding out for lipstick? Lingerie? Or am I not your... type?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gay. In prison, I thought about puss-- women all the time. But now... it's not working. Who knows, all those years on ice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's just gonna take some time. Before you're completely thawed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's slipped a hand inside his pocket for warmth... now pulls out the SCRAPS of paper, with women's faces. She squints at these in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) What are these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. They just... sorta reminded me of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS speaks carefully, unsure how to articulate this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a woman, the last woman I saw before... when I was under, the dead time-- she kept coming to me. I think she must've saved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't compete with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes, settling against him, her head again his chest. Marcus stares up into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARKNESS. We just make out KYLE and STAR among the other PRISONERS, most of whom are awake now in the steel contai Star still wears her baseball cap. The prisoners are JOST as the transport touches down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRANSPORT has landed amongst numerous CONTAINERS, CRA and VEHICLES-- all is dimly lit, enveloped in a vague red HAZE. THE FLYING FRAMEWORK and ARMATURE detach from the TRANSPORT, and TAKE OFF into the air again-- leaving the trailer-like wheeled CONTAINER. Something resembling the of a semi-truck backs into position, latching onto attach points on the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A SMALL PANEL SLIDES OPEN   at the front of the transpo and a half-dozen PROCESSING   AEROSTATS buzz inside from cab. These are larger than    the spy drones, with attach PINCERS that can encircle a   person's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRISONERS duck, try to dodge these things. But they quick buzz from captive to captive, latching onto their arms-- hear SCREAMS, see FLASHES OF LIGHT from the aerostats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE tries to bat away an AEROSTAT, but its PINCERS latch onto his forearm. A SIZZLING SOUND-- Kyle CRIES OUT with pain, a flash of RED LIGHT-- then the aerostat DETACHES a moves to its next victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR gets the same treatment from a different AEROSTAT. moves to Kyle's side, tears in her eyes, sucking on her burned wrist to ease the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE looks grimly down at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a fresh BAR CODE seared into his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAB and CONTAINER, now resembling a semi, pulls out o the loading area. Digitally controlled, it needs no headlights as it rolls in the near-darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD ANGLE as the vehicle moves onto a cloverleaf acc ramp leading to a HIGH SPEED SUNKEN HIGHWAY, a river of f moving TRAFFIC heading in both directions-- unlit vehicle moving close together at 120 mph through the reddish gloo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - BLAIR and MARCUS's feet trudge through low brush, step over undergrowth. CAMERA MOVES to find a STRAND OF BARBED WIRE, emerging from the dirt a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS pauses, almost having stepped on a WATERMELON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in somebody's garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR stops walking, alarmed, a few feet away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ... there's supposed to be barbed wire along the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS looks around them, points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few yards away, STRINGS OF BARBED WIRE... CAMERA MOVES reveal it's behind as well as ahead of them. They've come through a gap where the wire had fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Morrison, Barnes! Can anybody hear me?! (to Marcus) We're in the middle of the mine field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.   OUTPOST/BARRACKS & COMMUNICATIONS AREA - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARK. We hear BABIES CRYING from nearby, FUMBLING in the dark, muttered CURSES-- then a MATCH lights a CANDLE. BARNES, 20-ish, good-looking and cocky, yawns and sneers, annoyed at being awakened. TWO WOMEN share his mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody feed those things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start up the generator, Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORRISON is bearded, long-haired, bleary-eyed, a middle-a man in charge here. He sits up in bed, also beside A COUP OF WOMEN. This place has become an underground crash pad, communal living for about a dozen people-- Morrison and Barnes the only men, four or five WOMEN and quite a few CHILDREN of varying age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES grunts, yanks the blanket off his bedmates, who CR OUT in protest. He wraps it around himself, carries the candle as he steps around other SLEEPING FIGURES, makes h way toward a METAL STAIRCASE winding downward. Moments later, we hear a GAS ENGINE start up-- LIGHTS flicker on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is pretty grimy and run-down, but it was once a military environment. There's a BANK OF TV MONITORS again one wall, which COME TO LIFE. A couple of the WOMEN move toward the adjacent NURSERY AREA to tend to the babies-- of them, LISA, moves to the TV MONITORS. She squints at o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got company!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS and BLAIR in the exact positions we last saw them, looking exhausted. They CRY OUT, unheard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES pokes his head up from a concealed TRAPDOOR thirty yards from BLAIR and MARCUS, who are hoarse from shouting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair? Good to see you. (off her glare) What's the password?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat shit and die, Barnes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close enough. Who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you get us outta here please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda dumb-ass, wandering around in a mine field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't maintain the perimeter! Where are your sentries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too early for that military crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES consults a MAP, turning it to orient himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES (cont'd) OK, if you keep walking straight you're gonna get blown all to hell... turn to your left and take, oh... five steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR and MARCUS obey, moving cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES (cont'd) OK, face me now. Three steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do as told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES (cont'd) Almost home. Turn to your right and take another five steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slowly pace five steps.      On the fifth one, there CLICK beneath Marcus' foot--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrified moment of eye contact between him and Blair-- DIVES TO THE GROUND, away from him as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!   MARCUS is thrown through the air by the EXPLOSION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS' BODY lands a few feet from the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantic action-- the unconscious MARCUS is carried down a corridor from the open trap door by BARNES, MORRISON and couple of women, NANCY and LISA. BLAIR, bleeding from shrapnel injuries, assists. She yells at BARNES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You goddamn idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was takin' bigger steps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch is heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is deposited gingerly on a METAL TABLE in this cru MEDICAL AREA. Numerous INFANTS and TODDLERS about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE, a doctor, moves toward MARCUS with scissors and oth medical tools, cuts away a tattered pants leg, the shreds his sneaker. She stops and stares, palpates a BLACKENED L briefly. She looks up in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stepped on a Claymore? This guy oughta be in a hundred pieces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a scalpel, pulls it across the CHARRED, HEAT- DEFORMED SKIN. It doesn't even leave an incision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have a prosthetic limb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE opens Marcus' shrapnel-torn shirt, takes the scalpel gingerly pulls it across the flesh of his chest. No effec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not skin... oh Jesus-- oh God--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE looks at MORRISON, backing away from Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE (cont'd) He's a terminator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEMORY MONTAGE: QUICK SHOTS-- altered, impressionistic, a before. SFX of STATIC, high-pitched, complex DIGITAL NOIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a detached, fleshless metal framework for a ROBOTIC HAN suspended by wires-- it FLEXES, forming a FIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CAMERA CIRCLES a muscular MALE TORSO, without arms, leg head. METALLIC ATTACHMENT POINTS await these missing part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
