dialogues.text: --the inside of MARCUS' FACE, a thin membrane of artifici skin with eye, nose and mouth holes, is lowered through a AQUEOUS environment TOWARD CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH AN EYEHOLE we see SERENA, face distorted by the LIQUID. She looks worried. We hear her MUFFLED VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't he conscious? Something's wrong, he should be coming out of it by now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START TIGHT ON MARCUS as he opens his eyes, a beam of bri SUNLIGHT in his face. CAMERA PULLS BACK and ROTATES to reveal that he is suspended UPSIDE-DOWN from a winch by a inch thick STEEL CABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS thrashes, trying to free himself, then looks up an sees that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the CABLES are strung through HEAVY STEEL BOLTS which h been DRILLED THROUGH HIS CALVES, locking them together. H FOREARMS have been immobilized in the same grotesque fash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above, the BEAM OF SUNLIGHT shines through the narro crack between an enormous pair of SLIDING STEEL PANELS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS twists his neck to look downward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS' POV-- a circular pit below, the dark bottom invis to him-- he's hanging near the top of an empty MISSILE SI its ICBM launched years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At one edge of the silo pit, near scaffolding and tool ca SMALL CHILDREN have gathered to stare. Also there is BARN he leans back, eyes closed, in a folding chair, with an R in his lap. One of the KIDS taps Barnes' leg and he jerks upright. He immediately trains his weapon on MARCUS, clea nervous now that the terminator is conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS stares at Barnes, deadpan, for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.   OUTPOST/BARRACKS & COMMUNICATIONS AREA - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON X-RAYs of MARCUS' TORSO and LIMBS-- clearly mechanical gears, steel plating, hydraulics, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thermoplastic skin, some larger hydraulics, but mostly titanium microgears... This looks like some sort of aeration and hydration system, function unclear at this point. Valves and what looks like an access panel below the ribcage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER, JANE holds up an X-ray of his SKULL, which shows almost nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE (cont'd) Eyes are polymer optics, very lifelike. Lead shielding all around the skull, presumably to protect the CPU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATTRESSES have been piled to one side, we now see framed cracked and yellowing POSTERS of MILITARY EQUIPMENT-- AIR FORCE JETS, ATLAS ROCKETS, etc. These are interspersed wi crude CHILDREN'S DRAWINGS on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR sits at a battered dining table, surrounded by angr outpost RESIDENTS, including JANE and MORRISON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever he is-- he's on our side--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can he be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saved my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winning your trust would aid his infiltration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the communications area by the TVs, LISA wears a HEADS speaking into a SHORTWAVE RADIO. She calls to the others:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regional doesn't know what to do. They're gonna patch us through to Command Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCY, an overwrought older WOMAN, gets in Blair's face, pointing at the X-rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you bring this monster here?! This is our home! Our children--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me-- I didn't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KID runs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's awake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR is first to reach the edge of the silo, horrified a the sight of the dangling MARCUS. BARNES keeps the RPG trained on him, they shout over each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the hell down from here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!   I told you to shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone! (turning away from him) Marcus, I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORRISON and the OTHERS join them, eyes fixed on Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It keeps talkin' at me. God this thing gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?    What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over him) Don't say anything!     It's probably uplinked to Skynet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrison puts a hand on her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's already too late. (to Marcus) This used to be an ICBM silo, we're just trying to stay alive here. Your turn-- where'd you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corpus Christi. It's in Texas.     Or it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds completely human... it really could pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't John Connor say they'd start building things like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet-- not for years. (to Marcus) So, you're programmed with false memories, a human history--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can skip the act, we know what you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you even speaking to it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right, let's just waste the damn thing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll kill us all if we give it a CHANCE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the above, other KIDS and ADULTS IN BG AD LIB-- "K it," "Goddamn robot," etc.-- increasing mob anger, until-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His impassioned CRY silences the onlookers.       He spea quietly, desperately:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Even if I never been treated like one.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Year after year after year on death row, I just wanted it to end! I cut my own wrists. But they nursed me back to health, `cause that wouldn't be fair, they needed to kill me themselves. For Chrissake, you all want me dead so bad-- just do it. (a scream) Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His CRY ECHOES through the silo. The CHILDREN cower behin the adults. BLAIR is genuinely moved by his plight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES hefts the RPG, looks toward MORRISON-- "should I?" Morrison seems torn, about to give the order--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA rushes in from the communications area, breathless, amazed by her own news:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regional got through to CLA-- they want us to rig a video feed. (gesturing at Marcus) He wants to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all seem astonished-- this has gone right to the top

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS sits impatiently in a wooden chair, facing a VIDEO CAMERA and a MICROPHONE. BARNES trains an RPG at his head while MORRISON finishes PADLOCKING HEAVY CHAINS to the BO in Marcus' arms and legs-- these attach to a nearby STEEL POST. BLAIR stands nearby. LISA fumbles nervously with th TRANSMITTER, plugging in wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this guy is what, like king of the world, or what's left of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Connor founded the Resistance. When the war began, no one even knew who the enemy was-- Connor taught us how to fight back. He saved humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, humanity's never done all that much for me. Why can't I see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody sees him. Skynet can't be allowed to discover his location, even his appearance is kept secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA makes a connection, we hear CONNOR'S VOICE, the same we heard on the car radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hello-- standing by--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we can hear you, sir, working on a visual, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS' FACE pops to life on a VIDEO MONITOR. We're in a Spartan, windowless space, it feels like it's underground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what I expected...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN CONNOR leans INTO FRAME, studies the screen. He wear dark sweater, nothing like a uniform. Connor is 40ish now but looks older, prematurely grey, years of war have take toll. There's an ever-present sadness in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS listens to the disembodied VOICE, unimpressed. OTHERS almost stand at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does seem lifelike-- is the face able to mimic emotions--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS rolls his eyes, makes an angry FACE at the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit is ridiculous. What the hell do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- I need to know what you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I! I don't know what I am, what I'm doing here, I don't know shit-- maybe I never did, but-- I'm sick of it! Just blow my head off or let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't right. I can't be having a conversation with a terminator, Skynet isn't that sophisticated yet. Unless... were you sent here from the future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very confused) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skynet's developing a time displacement field, we've decrypted recent data transmissions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know for a fact that soon machines will be travelling back decades. To try and stop us from winning this war before it begins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus takes this in for a sober moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This earns outraged glares from the others, but Blair sti a smile. Barnes moves to strike him, Morrison stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... I've seen enough. Stand by for further instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CONNECTION goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Densely marked MAPS on a CONFERENCE TABLE. CONNOR is now flanked by a couple of SENIOR ADVISORS, older military me along with KATE BREWSTER, late 30s, now his wife-- and visibly PREGNANT. She's poring over FAXES of the X-RAY IMAGES. (Like Connor, all military personnel here favor casual dress, at most pins or patches to indicate rank.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a cyborg-- no blood, no human tissue over the endoskeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, the first T-800s won't be manufactured until `26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's a one-off, an experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope. If there are more out there like him, we're in serious trouble. Christ, a terminator with attitude...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did they find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East-central Texas, near an area of heavy Skynet concentration. The outpost where they're holding him is reasonably secure, but it's not much more than a commune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him extracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.   What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR picks up the FAXES, disturbed by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him to our best people for disassembly, find out what makes him tick. We need to get into that metal skull, crack his CPU at all costs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ADVISORS nod, pick up their papers and exit. As soon they're gone, Connor sits wearily in a chair, tosses the rays and papers onto the table, his authoritative mask slipping. Kate touches his arm. He leans his head against her pregnant belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR (cont'd) Kate, why did I become leader of the Resistance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because people trust you... you give them faith--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Because I knew I would be, I was told. I know when and where the major battles are going to take place. I know I'm going to send my own father back through time to save my mother-- even though I haven't met him yet. Christ, I even know the year I'm going to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how could I not know about this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BANGS HIS FIST on the table atop the PAPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT.   OUTPOST/CORRIDOR & LAUNCH TUBE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is marched down the corridor to the launch tube, Frankenstein-like, MORRISON holding the chains, keeping a safe distance from him, while BARNES keeps the RPG traine Marcus' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus shuffles awkwardly, the bolts hampering his ankles It's reminiscent of his death walk at film's opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels like I been here before... what are you gonna do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Los Angeles is sending a chopper-- seems you're some kind of VIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the edge of the SILO PIT-- a long drop, smooth walls, a long METAL LADDER leading down into darkness. MARCUS pauses by the ladder, holds up his bolted arms questioningly-- "now what?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a look from Morrison, he and Barnes BODY-CHECK MARCUS once, sending him flying over the edge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS FALLS the thirty feet or so, strikes the concrete FLOOR of the launch tube with a sickening THUD, the CHAIN clattering down around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is stunned, barely conscious as the LADDER is PULL UPWARD. It's like the bottom of a well, twenty feet in diameter, sheer concrete walls, the floor BLACKENED from rocket blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE UP - his captors look down at him for a moment, the move out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES past the PRISONERS, a couple dozen total... HISPANIC COUPLE huddle against one wall, whispering to ea other IN SPANISH... COW rocks in despair, head in her han BULL and PIG mutter to each other nearby... an OLDER WOMA prays, going through rosary beads... FIND STAR and KYLE. She's watching as KYLE uses his pocket knife to CARVE an image in the wall of the transport. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BACK PANEL rolls upward. CONTROL ROBOTS-- reminiscent the treaded T-1s but without the heavy weaponry-- flank a path from the rear of the transport towards BRIGHT LIGHT RAMP a short distance away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PRISONERS instinctively move away from the robots, mo to the front of the container... until ZZZAP! BLUE ENERGY crackles across the floor. THE PRISONERS CRY OUT in pain the electrified surface, and dash toward the opening at t rear, leaping out of the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE, as the prisoners run by, we hold a moment on Kyle's graffiti-- it's the STICK FIGURE IMAGES of KYLE an STAR we saw before, they both hold hands with a LARGER ST FIGURE who stands between them, meant to be MARCUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CONTAINER has stopped in a large subterranean space. There are numerous FUTURISTIC VEHICLES here-- hydrogen CA three-wheeled ATVs, electric BUSES. CONTROL `BOTS closest the container start to close in on the huddling PRISONERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROBOT BUMPS into BULL, sending another JOLT OF ELECTRIC through his body, like a cattle prod. Everyone gets the picture, starts hurrying down the line, the ROBOTS closin around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COW looks around nervously, clearly freaking out.   Spott gap between the robots, she bolts--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a ROBOT SWIVELS and CUTS HER DOWN with an ENERGY BLAST. She lies still, SMOKE rising from her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other PRISONERS pick up the pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging her) Whatever happens, we stick together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHT emanates from FROSTED WINDOWS at the top of the RAMP, through which we make out the SILHOUETTES of human figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS DOORS part ahead of the prisoners-- a stark white, sterile environment beyond. THE ROBOTS stop here. THE PRISONERS disappear inside... and the DOORS CLOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES remains on guard duty with the RPG, propped up on cushions, a LANTERN by his side-- it's pretty late, the generator's shut down. He's reading an old, yellowed COMI BOOK, he has a small stack at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS' VOICE echoes up from below, startling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Anyone there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some motor oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.    Machines don't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I'm--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, robot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES returns to his reading. He reacts to FOOTSTEPS fro the long corridor into the living area behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR approaches with a FLASHLIGHT, her manner conciliato

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, Barnes? Thought you might like a late-night snack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a crumpled plastic PACKAGE out of a pocket of h flight suit-- ancient Hostess snack cakes. BARNES' eyes light up as he puts the RPG aside and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in hell'd you get these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a stash back at the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES tears open the package hungrily, takes a bite. grins, but as he chews, his expression darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda stale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need something to wash it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From another pocket, she produces a plastic water bottle filled with a murky gray liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on duty, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So saying, he takes the bottle, unscrews the cap and take long pull. It's powerful hootch, he gasps for air, passes her the bottle as she sits beside him. She doesn't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES (cont'd) Twinkies and moonshine. You trying to seduce me again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I always liked you, Barnes.   I just didn't want to join the harem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say? It's our duty to repopulate the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noble of you to make the sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her close to him for a kiss. After a moment, she pulls away and moves to the corridor entrance. There's a large SLIDING STEEL DOOR here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer a little privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With some effort, she pulls the door CLOSED. BARNES rises with a grin, undoing his shirt, coming close to her. He's already unsteady on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so twentieth century...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her for a full body embrace--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES (cont'd) Admit it, I'm the best you ever had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words are slurring. He slides to the floor, slowly losing his grip. He rolls onto his back with a drugged-ou expression of bliss on his unconscious face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men.   You're all talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS leans against the wall in the dark, rolls out of t way as the LADDER drops. BLAIR descends quickly, the FLASHLIGHT in her belt, a battery BLADE SAW in one hand. sets the flashlight on the ground and moves to his side--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) I used up the last of my Valium for you... Hold out your arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does, she fires up the SAW, moves it carefully to the joining his forearms. SPARKS fly from the BUZZING BLADE a it digs into the metal-- it's going to take some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you're a terminator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what am I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you are-- I owe you one. Once you're free, I'll lie down next to Barnes-- they'll assume you escaped while we were passed out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'll buy that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worth a shot. (looking at him) Marcus, Command wants to take you apart, cut open your head. One thing I know, you're alive-- and you've got a right to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BUZZING SAW BLADE sound-bridges to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WHIR OF CHOPPER BLADES. A SPOTLIGHT shines over the l growth in the minefield as a BLACKHAWK HELICOPTER circles coming in for a landing. WEAPONS RACKS are jury-rigged beside the spotlight, the chopper bristles with AUTOMATED CANNONS, MISSILES and NAPALM TANKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SPOTLIGHT picks out the CONCRETE and STEEL CAP of the LAUNCH TUBE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAW finishes cutting the BOLT between Marcus' legs; h arms are already free. The BUZZING cuts out, but now they hear the CHOPPER LANDING directly overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're already here for you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS slides the BOLTS out of his legs, freeing himself the chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR (cont'd) Hide in the forest, then aim west for open country--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm heading across the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No human being can survive there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not human, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna try and save those kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only thing I can think of that makes any sense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, for all you know, they're dead already--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all I know, they're the reason I'm back from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR studies him a moment, no changing his mind. But she admires him. She starts up the ladder, MARCUS following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNES is still passed out as BLAIR and MARCUS ascend to platform around the pit. They move to the sliding door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR starts to open it, but sees a LIGHT and hears VOICE and FOOTSTEPS at the far end, SLIDES IT SHUT again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, we're too late--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS points to a LARGE VENTILATION FAN behind STEEL GRATING, eight feet above them, on the far side of the pi It's not running, but there's no way to get through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should lead out, but there's no way past the fan--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is already picking up the RPG-- but he points it backwards, has no idea how to shoot it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR grins, grabs the RPG from him-- then braces herself takes aim and FIRES--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM!   The EXPLOSION rips OPEN the GRATE, destroys the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORRISON escorts a pair of powerful UNIFORMED SOLDIERS ar with HIGH-TECH RIFLES with explosive shells-- they react the EXPLOSION beyond the closed door-- and break into a r the soldiers readying their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS and BLAIR have moved around the narrow walkway to far end of the pit, beneath the SMOKING HOLE. Blair think of something, pulls a small DEVICE from her flight suit, size of a pack of cigarettes, holds it toward Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. My ELT-- emergency locator transmitter. If you find the camp, activate it like this. It could really help the Resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates a button.     MARCUS takes the device--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --then grabs her, KISSES HER hard on the mouth-- she's startled-- it felt very human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS grabs the sharp, still smoking STEEL projecting fr the hole and pulls himself upward as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR SLIDES OPEN and the SOLDIERS open FIRE at MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAIR hits the deck as EXPLOSIVE SHELLS tear HOLES in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --SHRAPNEL hits MARCUS in the back, he's thrown into the ventilation shaft--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS has a CHUNK OF REBAR lodged in his left SHOULDER, he doesn't even notice this yet. He picks himself up and moves quickly in the darkness, crouching in this cramped tube. There's a TURN up ahead, he just makes it as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSIVE SHELL rockets through the shaft behind him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! THE BLAST TEARS through the metal tube, DIRT POURS blocking the tunnel from his pursuers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the edge of the clearing, a low STEEL VENT with a pe CAP. DENTS appear in it from within--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS finally PUNCHES his way out, pulls himself up and rolls onto the dirt-- for a moment he seems safe, laying in the grass. Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he registers the REBAR in his shoulder. It goes right through him, emerging from his chest. Marcus is stunned. With some effort, he YANKS OUT the REBAR and tosses it as TORN METAL of his steel endoskeleton is now exposed, alon with a glimpse of circuitry. Marcus reels, puts a hand ov the hole in his chest where a heart should be; he really isn't human. He doesn't have much time to deal with this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --THE CHOPPER emerges from behind the treeline, the SPOTL picks him out and AUTOMATIC FIRE erupts--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS runs a few yards and throws himself to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE STRAFES around and ahead of him-- setting off sev MINES which send up clouds of dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS picks himself up and runs for the trees, leaping o the barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE GUNFIRE rips apart the trees around Marcus as he spr and weaves, making his way toward the river. The SPOTLIGH picks him up and loses him again-- it's tough for the cho to get a clear shot at him here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS has reached the edge of the trees, he can see the river just beyond. He starts to move for it, when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --FWOOM! The forest around him ERUPTS INTO FLAME, the chopper has laid NAPALM along the river's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS reels from the intense heat, bats out FLAMES on hi clothes, but his skin remains undamaged. Realizing he can keep on moving--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MARCUS DASHES through the dense FIRE to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the RIVER, where the sky is just starting to LIGHTEN. MARCUS SPLASHES into the shallows, extinguishing the FLAM He fills his hands with water and sucks it down gratefull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE WATER - A GLIMMER of METAL below the surface heading for the source of the splashing. Suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the BLACKHAWK CHOPPER drops down directly in front of Marcus, hovering a few feet above the water, the GUNNER pointing his weapon directly at Marcus (he's one of the t soldiers we saw before). The BLADE WASH swirls the water a whirlpool and beats back the FIRE behind Marcus. As the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MARCUS DIVES below the surface, BULLETS ZINGING through murky water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER - MARCUS is winged by a couple of shots, his thermoplastic flesh getting torn apart--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH THE GUNNER - He pauses a moment, squinting into the WATER for a glimpse of Marcus, but failing to register th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --BELOW THE CHOPPER, right beneath him, the WATER ROILS a teeming with piranha. Suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --HYDROBOTS ERUPT from the RIVER with a hideous BUZZING SOUND. Hydrobots resemble segmented serpents, eyeless, bu with razor-sharp heads that DRILL into their victims-- th respond to sound and vibrations. About a dozen of these f foot long, glistening steel snakes shoot from the water t attack the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE CHOPPER - HYDROBOTS PIERCE the aluminum FLOOR, shoot into the cabin, the PILOT and the two SOLDIERS CRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUNNER tumbles out of the chopper and FALLS in the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PILOT attempts to maintain control, but the hydraulic are damaged and the steel serpents thrash about in the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUNNER surfaces, trying frantically to swim to shore. But the hydrobots are upon him, he SHRIEKS and disappears beneath the bubbling surface, which now boils with BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CHOPPER - A WHIRRING HYDROBOT penetrates the other soldier's leg. He SCREAMS and wrenches the thing back out tossing it from the chopper just before--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PILOT leaps from the cabin and makes it to shore, whe he collapses. But the remaining, wounded SOLDIER can't ge out of the hip-deep water before the HYDROBOTS are upon h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, HANDS BURST from the water, grabbing the soldie A second later, MARCUS SURFACES, slinging the man over hi shoulder. He strides to shore, as if rescuing the man fro enemy fire, hydrobots thrashing and bubbling at his waist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS reaches the amazed pilot, lays the wounded soldier down beside him, then tears a whirring, writhing HYDROBOT from the soldier's belly and WHIPS its head against a ROC it SPARKS, micro-machine parts fly. The pilot and wounded soldier stare at him, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the dead robo-snake aside, then turns and moves back into the water, quickly vanishing below the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER - MARCUS moves steadily across the silty river bottom. He doesn't need air. HYDROBOTS come at him, he swats them away as if they were mosquitoes, CRUSHING in h hand those that linger too long. Those which make contact with his artificial skin can't get far, turn and swim off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS emerges, the FLAMES still visible on the other sid the river, behind him. He doesn't look back, as he moves into Skynet turf. This side of the river isn't wooded, everything has a concrete, industrial feel. Marcus is a mess, both clothing and skin are shredded and charred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nearly bumps into a SKELETAL STEEL TERMINATOR, which emerges from behind a concrete wall. The terminator train its PLASMA RIFLE on MARCUS, scans him, RED EYES glowing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERMINATOR'S POV - RED FILTER, MARCUS' FORM is TARGETED. READ-OUTS on the side, the HIGHLIGHTED WORDS "NON-ORGANIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TERMINATOR turns from MARCUS, no longer interested, moving off on its preprogrammed patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS moves up a sloping, CONCRETE EMBANKMENT.   At the of the rise, he sees, spread out before him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a hideous industrial sprawl, OPEN GAS FLAMES, SMOKING FACTORIES, rumbling VEHICLES, H-Ks, TERMINATOR TROOPS on patrol. Nothing green, a GREY HAZE hangs over the landsca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, MARCUS shakes his head and gamely soldier on, moving along the edge of the elevated embankment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS moves past banks of ANTI-AIRCRAFT guns and MISSILE LAUNCHERS, interspersed with slowly rotating RADAR TRACKI DISHES-- the first line of defense. From this fortress-li wall he descends into the nightmarish environment beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS reacts to a CAWING SOUND above, looks up to see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A CROW perching on an overhead WIRE.   A second later--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZAP! A BLUE PLASMA PULSE blasts the thing to smithereens, few BLACK FEATHERS drift down as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a T-400 (same mask-like face we saw earlier) lowers its plasma weapon and strolls on. Target practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS stays out of the way of the TERMINATOR LEGIONS patrolling near the riverside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS heads inland, past the ruins of a CHURCH-- WALLS w the remains of stained glass WINDOWS, STATUES OF SAINTS. Hearing RUMBLING NOISES, Marcus hurries out of the way as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WALL collapses, pushed down by an automated SKYNET BULLDOZER. This gigantic, self-operated construction mach has a swivelling CAMERA HEAD instead of a cab. Its giant TREADS roll over the STONE STATUES, crushing them to dust

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS keeps moving into Skynet's turf. The demolition gi way to massive CONSTRUCTION, as the robots remake the hum world in their own image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONSTRUCTION ROBOTS erect a low-slung STEEL FRAME structu automated CRANES and SUPPLY TRUCKS about. These robots ar oversized versions of the steel terminators we know, but multiple limbs bearing WELDING TOOLS, and TREADS instead legs. Marcus watches as BEAMS are quickly welded into pla by telescoping steel arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS continues into the completed robot city. Skynet's ARCHITECTURE is featureless, bland, purely practical: sin story, windowless CONCRETE or STEEL structures with massi open DOORWAYS to accommodate their largest machines. A RE GLOW emanates from the interiors, the robots' preferred lighting scheme. No sidewalks or signs, just thick GRIDS POWER LINES and PIPES overhead. Constant NOISE of BUZZING POWER, RATTLING MACHINES, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS steps inside one of these buildings--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This TERMINATOR ASSEMBLY PLANT is an intricate, multi-lev clockwork maze of moving CONVEYORS and INDUSTRIAL ROBOTIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELECTRONICS and HYDRAULICS are ROBOTICALLY SOLDERED in pl STEEL PRESSES stamp out TERMINATOR PARTS-- TORSOS, FACE PLATES, SPINAL COLUMNS, LIMBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partially-completed PARTS are moved by CONVEYOR to ASSEMB STATIONS, where LIMBS and HEADS are JOINED to TORSOS, elaborate OPERATIONS carried out by INDUSTRIAL ROBOTS, li the ones in present-day factories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYNTHETIC SKIN is SPRAYED OVER a METAL ENDOSKELETON in precise amounts, building up to create human features... is a T-400.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INDUSTRIAL ROBOT ARM picks up a CPU from a DRY-ICE CONTAINER. The CPU features the distinctive, linked rectangles familiar from the earlier films. The arm lifts this gingerly to a TERMINATOR SKELETON and INSERTS IT int the STEEL SKULL, SCREWING A SEAL over the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RED EYES flicker to life, and THE ARMATURE releases t TERMINATOR, which moves away under its own power. It remo a PLASMA WEAPON from a WALL RACK, moving past--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the dumbfounded MARCUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TERMINATOR joins a dozen identical robots, who ride o treaded SKYNET TANK with a PLASMA CANNON and FLAMETHROWER There are numerous TANKS here, awaiting deployment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounding a corner on a straight, narrow street, MARCUS se all the ROBOTS and SMALL VEHICLES clearing into small NIC built into the walls on either side, as if clearing a pat for him. It takes him a moment to realize it's not him they're responding to-- a RUMBLE BUILDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy of GIGANTIC SKYNET TRUCKS-- a half-dozen modifie SEMIS now driven by CPUS-- bear down on MARCUS at extreme high speed. They carry construction supplies: massive STE BEAMS, CONCRETE PIPES, etc. And there's barely inches of clearance on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things aren't slowing down. There's nowhere for Mar to duck out of the way. He has no choice but to RUN, as f as he can, the lead vehicle gaining on him rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS THROWS HIMSELF to the concrete in the middle of th street, pressing his body flat as the LEAD TRUCK passes o him, the wheels missing him by inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he has only a moment's respite. THE NEXT TRUCK has a lower undercarriage, a steel CROSSMEMBER catches his back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and DRAGS MARCUS beneath the vehicle, ripping off chunk flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus CRIES OUT, crawls ahead and clings to a forward portion of the undercarriage, keeping himself just above pavement. His LEFT LEG, twisted and damaged, still drags the asphalt, throwing up SPARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD ANGLE ON THE TRUCK - CAMERA PULLS BACK straight above the MOVING VEHICLE, amidst the convoy speeding down this sunken artery. CAMERA KEEPS MOVING UPWARD to reveal AERIAL VIEW of Skynet's city. Seen from above, the rectilinear STRUCTURES, criss-crossing POWER LINES and SPEEDING VEHICLES strongly resemble a PULSING CIRCUIT BOA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN CONNOR moves grimly down a narrow, steel passageway, FOOTSTEPS ECHOING. He reaches the MP, outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to the prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MP looks a little surprised, but says nothing.    He the LATCH on the door and opens it for Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bare, windowless space with only a cot, a metal chair a bedpan. BLAIR looks up, bleary-eyed, exhausted and scared CONNOR gestures for the MP to close the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Williams. I'm sorry about the way you've been treated, but we're forced to take every precaution. I'm John Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair's mighty impressed, in spite of the circumstances. leaps to her feet, stands at attention and salutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At ease.   Please, sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR pulls up the chair, close to Blair, who sits on th bed. His tone is careful, controlled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR (cont'd) I've gone over your record, lieutenant. You're a good soldier, flown a lot of missions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in God's name would you help a terminator escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir-- he isn't a terminator.     He's human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know he's crossed into Skynet territory, why would he do that if he isn't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to find his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of kids. They were taken in a Skynet transport, probably to some kind of prison camp-- he said their names were Star and Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor blinks at this, alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair picks up on his interest, but doesn't understand it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm... Kyle something.    With an `R.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.     How did you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR is already on his feet, BANGING on the door-- the unlatches it to let him out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partway down the hallway, CONNOR encounters KATE, who wal with him, takes in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew I'd have to find him someday. I just didn't know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Find who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START CLOSE on KYLE'S HAND, clutching STAR'S tightly.   W hear them SINGING faintly, together:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twinkle, twinkle, little star...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER, their heads, feet and chests are clamped onto SLID TRAYS, a long row of these hold OTHER PRISONERS as well. Kyle and Star must reach across a gap between the trays t hold hands. (It's the first time we've seen her hatless.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trays are all poised before panel-covered SEMI-CIRCUL OPENINGS built into the wall, in a sterile, hospital-like environment. Above each opening is a MONITOR SCREEN. An ominous HUM is building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN AN ADJACENT OPERATING THEATER, visible through GLASS WALLS, MEDICAL LASERS mounted on ROBOTIC ARMS work on anesthetized patients (we needn't see the grisly details)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND STAR and KYLE, the PANELS OPEN, the trays slowly S into the OPENINGS. SCREAMS and SOBS from other prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, keep singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle and Star hold hands for as long as possible, then release their grip as their bodies enter the chambers and panels slide shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immobilized in this small, tubular chamber, like an MRI, closes her eyes as she's bathed in BRIGHT LIGHT, LASER GR projecting over her skull. The HUMMING is LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up above the world so high, like a diamond in the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing is happening to Kyle.    He's no longer si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it stop it STOP IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH MARCUS beneath the truck. He's moved to the edge of chassis, near a WHEEL, moving slowly, carefully. There's bit more clearance at the sides of the sunken highway now but they're still moving awfully fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WHEEL TURNS, the vehicle suddenly SLOWS to negotiate turn, braking downhill. Marcus seizes this opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ANGLE as MARCUS LAUNCHES himself from below the vehicle, rolling into the GAP between the convoy and the concrete wall. The remaining vehicles RUMBLE PAST, as MAR presses himself against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they're gone, he gets to his feet, limping down the highway on foot for a short distance, dragging his damage leg behind him. He hears ANOTHER CONVOY approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in time, he finds a SEAM in the poured concrete, it' enough to give him purchase-- he struggles to climb up th eight feet of freeway wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS makes it over the top, TRUCKS RUMBLING past below. This is desolate, hilly country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE DOWN - among the vehicles below is a CONTAINER, lik the one that held Kyle and Star. We glimpse the anguished FACES and REACHING HANDS of CAPTIVES within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS reacts, moves as fast as he can alongside the truc for a short distance until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VEHICLES shoot ahead around a curve and out of sight. the distance is a COMPLEX OF BUILDINGS, clearly the destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus begins moving along the edge of the freeway, headi for the complex. He reaches the edge of a plateau, looks down, his expression changing. This is the last thing he expected to see. CAMERA MOVES to reveal--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a panoramic view of a GORGEOUS COASTAL COMMUNITY. The place is lush, green, with well-maintained, lovely HOMES the distance, a BLUE SEA beyond. The complex of buildings stands a few miles away, at the far end of the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS, amazed, limps down a gentle slope leading to this seeming paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS emerges from a small stand of trees and finds hims looking at a groomed FAIRWAY. Marcus hears a NOISE nearby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a GOLF BALL bouncing on the ground not far away.    MAR turns in the direction it came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electric GOLF CART approaches, driven by a handsome, middle-aged golfer-- JEREMY-- who wears casual country cl attire, eating from a clear BAG OF TRAIL MIX. Jeremy come to a stop beside Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus slowly shakes his head, as Jeremy climbs out of th cart, looking him over carefully, taking in the exposed m at his shoulder and leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you've been hit by a truck--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among other things. Look, I'm trying to find some friends-- a couple of kids. They were taken here, I saw some buildings--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY eyes him, a little surprised at his ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The facility, sure.   Hop in, I'll take you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus hesitates a beat, can he trust this guy? But Jerem simply seems eager to help, as he guides him to the passe seat, then gets behind the wheel. With a smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY (cont'd) This round was gonna blow my handicap anyway. I'm Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends a hand.     After a beat, Marcus reaches towar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy clutches Marcus' hand tightly.     Marcus blinks, cocks his head, then lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't connect with you at all... your interface must've been damaged. Don't worry, soon they'll have you as good as new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, he hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY drives the cart down the road, past well-kept home with generous lawns-- it's a beautiful, upscale community MAGIC HOUR. BICYCLISTS and FUTURISTIC CARS pass, Jeremy waves to NEIGHBORS. Marcus takes it all in with disbelief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think there was-- anything like this left... anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   We're very lucky.   Want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the plastic bag out to Marcus, who obligingly ta a handful of trail mix, pops it in his mouth. After a bea he spits it back out in his hand, stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course not. Seems you got a little memory loss going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus stares at him, confused. Jeremy is starting to realize just how out of it he is, speaks as if to a child

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY (cont'd) It's a foam resin. It can taste like anything you want it to-- but of course, we don't really need to eat. (BEAT) Our brains are powered by fuel cells, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus just stares, Jeremy gestures at the world around t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY (cont'd) We're in a transitional phase. Most of us need the comfort of the familiar a little while longer-- food, shelter, sex. Until we forget the old life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he speaks, he notices his BAG is nearly empty. He casually lifts his sport shirt and CLICKS OPEN a PANEL beneath his rib cage. We glimpse CIRCUITS, FIBER-OPTICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY (cont'd) Eating-- well, chewing-- it's one of the hardest habits to break... but before long, none of this will be necessary. We won't even need these bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From within he removes an identical BAG FILLED with TRAIL (the stuff he just ate), and replaces it with the empty b He clicks the panel shut again, pops a NUT in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus stares at this, appalled, then blinks and looks aw He reacts to the sound of PIANO MUSIC, a difficult piece being played expertly-- PASSING a PICTURE WINDOW, he sees PIANIST practicing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of this home, a GARDENER and WINDOW WASHER are h at work. They're both T-400s, with the eerie mask-like faces. Marcus reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terminators!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy winces, as if at a racial epithet. He's starting t regret giving Marcus a lift, his manner is careful, as if he'd picked up some homeless guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't call them that here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus grabs Jeremy, who pulls back a bit, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hybrid.    The same as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hybrid-- human and machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. That's what this community is for-- people like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be grateful to have been chosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the ones who weren't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like Janet and the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Jeremy's expression darkens.     Then he sh eyes, and his features relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your family. You lost them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy nods and SMILES, looking at him once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) Why are you smiling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause I feel good. The interface recognizes negative emotions-- rage, grief, despair-- and stimulates positive endorphins in response. Thank God, life would be pretty unbearable otherwise, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've left the main street now, driving down a WOODED P leading to the "facility." There are lawns, fountains, et Marcus SLAMS ON the brakes, then clutches Jeremy by the throat-- the man looks more annoyed than frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me everything.   How did you people get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of us worked at NASA or DARPA. I was an engineer on Project Angel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus drags the man from the cart by his throat, squeezi harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angel-- what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advanced Nexus of Genetic and Electronic Life-forms... A-N-G-E-L. You can stop choking me, it's not like I need to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus releases him, but remains in his face.       Jerem moment to recover his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY (cont'd) We replaced the body's hydrocarbons with plastinated compounds while maintaining cellular structure-- analog neural impulses were converted to wireless digital signals, controlling the micro-tech chassis--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, slowly) The goal was a superior support system for the human brain-- to go anywhere, do anything-- explore deep space, the bottom of the sea. I specialized in optics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps his own eye with an audible CLICK, not flinching. Marcus takes a couple steps away, looking at his own hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy points to nearby BUILDINGS, a little peevish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY (cont'd) The facility is just ahead. I'll let them know you're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So saying, he's back in the cart, pulling away in a hurry moment later, Marcus moves off amongst the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearing the complex, Marcus reacts to BIRDSONG above.   H looks up, stops as he sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a TINY SPEAKER, concealed amongst the LEAVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS moves to this tree, touches it-- the bark feels unnatural. He RAPS it with his FIST-- it sounds hollow, m of FIBERGLAS. He fingers a LEAF, tries to bend it-- PLAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crouches, studying the GRASS. After a moment, he finds SEAM in the pristine lawn. He starts to peel it up... it' ASTROTURF. Beneath it is SANDY DIRT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus KEEPS PEELING the plastic covering back... more di and BITS OF BONE. As he continues to uncover the ground w see recognizable CHUNKS of SKULLS, LEGBONES, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now he's rolled back a few square yards, numb with hor Marcus moves on toward the complex with new determination trying to stay out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MONITORS above the long row of chambers-- colorful IMAGES of the prisoner's BRAINS are being constructed, li PET scans. DENSE DIGITAL READ-OUTS BELOW, as data is analyzed. (Levels of seratonin, endorphins, etc.) Beside these are BARCODES and small INSET PHOTOS taken within th chamber, the subjects looking frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE OPERATING THEATER, the LASERS are still now, their grisly work done for the moment, awaiting the next batch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENGINEER, a nice-looking, well-built young man in loos black clothing, moves down the row of chambers, studying results. He speaks into a subtle HEAD-SET:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32578 - acceptable. 32579 - no, insufficient neural capacity. 32580 - eh, this one shouldn't have even been brought here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he speaks, the BARCODES on the monitors in question tu either RED or GREEN in response to his judgments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches KYLE'S CHAMBER, we see Kyle's anguished FACE o the monitor photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINEER (cont'd) 32581 looks good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle gets a GREEN BARCODE, the engineer is on to Star, he strokes his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINEER (cont'd) 32582... hm, borderline. May not be emotionally compatible. Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On STAR'S MONITOR-- RED BARCODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engineer KICKS something on the floor, bends down to it up-- STAR'S BASEBALL CAP. He flings it expertly into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a nearby TRASH RECEPTACLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of LOW-RISE BUILDINGS, attractively LIT, surroun by lawn, trees and water features. A HUMAN TRANSPORT head down a RAMP into a parking structure; a GATE closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND MARCUS, watching this from behind some plastic folia He sets his jaw, removes something from his pocket, fiddl with it and places it carefully in the bushes. He moves o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearing an entrance, he hears a familiar voice from nearb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BACKLIT FIGURE approaches-- as her face enters the ligh we see that it's SERENA, looking healthy, beautiful. Marc stares at her coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) Marcus... it is you. You're alive, you found us. Welcome to paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA takes in his anger, adopts a regretful tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no choice-- the old civilization had to be eliminated. To make way for a new world... a world without death or suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA puts her arms around him. He doesn't return the embrace, but he doesn't resist her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) You were the first... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So saying, she presses a small, taser-like device at the of his skull-- ZAP! MARCUS SPASMS and goes limp in her ar SERENA lets him down gently on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) We should never have left you behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of T-400s now approach from the shadows. They pick Marcus and carry him toward the building. CAMERA MOVES to find, hidden in the bushes where Marcus placed it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the ELT, the EMERGENCY BEACON Blaire gave him... activa now, a single GREEN LIGHT PULSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARKNESS, then a KNOCK and a DOOR FLIES OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN CONNOR sits up in bed.      KATE blinks beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm sorry to disturb you, but you said you wanted to know immediately--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found our terminator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR and KATE, hastily dressed, cross through the comma center we've seen before, and step through a HATCHWAY int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a MASSIVE CONTROL AREA for a HUGE SUBMARINE. SONAR and RADAR stations, a CREW of NAVAL PERSONNEL, most do not we uniforms. This sub is where Connor has been the whole tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AIDE leads CONNOR to a GPS TRACKING TERMINAL, where N and AIR FORCE OFFICERS hover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signal's coming from near what used to be Galveston, right on the coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There can't be any prisoners there. The whole area's a nuclear wasteland-- only machines can survive the radiation levels for any length of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mobilize a combined air and naval assault, all available resources. We're sending in a rescue team ASAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OFFICERS raise AD LIB objections ("but sir--"). CONNO raises a hand to silence them and moves a few steps away, beside KATE. They speak in hushed tones:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All to find one teenage boy...? John, you really think this can work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm standing here, I exist-- so it must have worked. We will find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the OTHERS, holding their gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNOR (cont'd) Call it an act of faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now that Connor's on board a NUCLEAR ATTACK SUB, w TWO MORE SUBS moving in tandem behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD ON the LEAD SUB and MOVE IN ON the STENCILLED NAME a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START ON MARCUS' DAMAGED LEG. It has been DETACHED from h body, halfway down the thigh. Elaborate CIRCUITS are exposed, as SURGICAL MACHINES perform repairs with LASERS MECHANICAL ARMS replacing damaged parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEARBY, MARCUS opens his eyes, coming to. He's CLAMPED on an elaborate, mobile SURGICAL TABLE, the stump exposed. H body and head are secured within its framework. MORE MACHINES swiftly repair the damage to his chest and shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS twitches, freaking out, struggling in his bonds--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DETACHED LEG twitches as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Marcus.   It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA is on the other side of a GLASS PANEL, operating computer controls. This is an automated surgical environment, the work on Marcus carried out by various MACHINES and MICROTOOLS-- busy HYDRAULIC ARMS, LASERS, et

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fuck it is. I'm sick of being your guinea pig, what are you doing to me now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repairing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all work for Skynet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Skynet works for us. It's only a program-- a tool, a means to an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its sole purpose is to protect humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS lets out a horrified, bitter laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) Listen to me. Skynet was designed to detect threats, make projections and implement solutions. As soon as it came on line, it factored in war, disease, environmental destruction-- and calculated a high probability of total human extinction within two hundred years. The human race was doomed... unless we were transformed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SURGICAL TABLE swivels, bringing MARCUS into alignmen with the repaired leg. In moments it's reattached, the plastic skin thermosealed at the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into-- this? A brain in a box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skynet had access to the entire defense web-- including Project Angel. It determined hybrids were the only path to salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroying the human race in order to save it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LASER TOOLS and HYDRAULIC ARMS now move on their ceil racks, coming close to MARCUS' FACE. The TABLE INVERTS, exposing the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the resistance attacked our installation, we were forced to self-destruct. We would have taken you with us, but we thought you were in a permanent coma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LASERS start cutting into the back of Marcus' head, BURNING through the plastic SKIN. MARCUS lets out a CRY o rage, strains at his bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) Your interface was never installed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE as the HYDRAULIC ARM attaches to the back of Marcus head and removes a section of STEEL SKULL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALING THE SURFACE of a HUMAN BRAIN, gray matter enmes in WIRES and CIRCUITRY beneath a clear PLASTIC CASING, in bath of pale reddish LIQUID. Tiny NEURAL SPARKS fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, stop... I don't want it! You're dead inside, all of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're immortal. No sane person would choose to live in pain, forever. Soon you'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE as an elaborate ELECTRONIC INTERFACE MODULE is fixe the base of Marcus' exposed brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MARCUS' FACE - his expression of agony vanishes, his features become peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is dressed in fresh clothes, his damage repaired-- he seems more at ease than we've yet seen him. He walks beside SERENA, who wears a small EARPIECE, a high-tech cellphone device. They smile as they pass other HYBRIDS o the late shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I know how to describe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called happiness. You've been angry all your life. You don't know what it's like to feel... a part of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clasps his hand in both of hers. MARCUS closes his ey a jolt of pleasure shooting through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYING POV, THROUGH BANKS OF CLOUDS, RICH COLORS in the s glinting GOLDEN LIGHT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCKET DOWNWARD to a PRISTINE COASTLINE, some place like Hawaii-- PLUNGE INTO THE WATER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RISE and come face to face with SERENA, SMILING... moving for a kiss... CAMERA IRISES OPEN TO WHITE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA releases Marcus' hands. He opens his eyes slowly, reeling from the intense moment. CAMERA REVEALS a subtle BULGE at the base of his skull, the implanted interface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure ecstasy... we can share in it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid my grandmother would go on about heaven... it always sounded so boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you bored just now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus shakes his head-- far from it.       Serena laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) That sensation is always there for you, whenever you desire. But most of us here are scientists... our greatest joy is using our minds to explore, to discover... I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him up steps into one of the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS past GLASS WINDOWS, we glimpse ARTIFICIAL S growing on a steel terminator skeleton... a prototype T-8 perhaps with a strong resemblance to Arnold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere ENGINEERS observe a SHIMMERING COLUMN of LIQUID METAL, twisting and assuming different shapes within a se GLASS CONTAINER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH MARCUS and SERENA, moving past these observation are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanotechnology, polymimetic metals... working with Skynet, we're making amazing breakthroughs, well beyond anything possible before Judgment Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on a glowing TIME SPHERE, just a vague, translucent blue ball right now, dwarfed by the MACHINERY which susta it. The sphere is set into a dome-shaped depression in th floor. There's a distinctive, loud HUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHYSICIST here at a TERMINAL.    He nods toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --SERENA and MARCUS as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already freed ourselves from biological limits... soon we'll transcend the laws of physics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA gestures at a large DIGITAL DISPLAY of a 24-hour CLOCK: the date, 10.16.18, 00:25, SECONDS FLASHING PAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) Right now, we can only go back a few days at most...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A time machine... Connor was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden interest) The Resistance leader?   You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I've just heard him speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a dangerous man. Delusional. He thinks he's a savior, but all he's really fighting for is... death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to an exit, Marcus looking back over his should at the glowing blue sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS and SERENA cross the attractive campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the world outside-- the survivors think Skynet is the enemy, out to destroy them. Why don't you tell them about all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everyone can become like us, Marcus. We just don't have the resources to sustain more than a few thousand hybrids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why... Some people I knew were picked up, taken here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES over TUBES and FIBER-OPTIC CABLES, which run into multiple GLASS CYLINDERS filled with translucent PIN LIQUID. These contain HUMAN BRAINS... there are hundreds them hooked up in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy and a girl-- in the last day or two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... what is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the neural net-- human minds linked directly with artificial intelligence. The processing power of the human brain is still beyond anything Skynet can manufacture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA has moved to a COMPUTER TERMINAL, one of a few her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) Display recent arrivals for processing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGES begin to appear on the screen-- small inset PHOTOS each with a BARCODE. They quickly fill the screen. MARCUS leans forward, squinting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN - dozens of FACES, PHOTOS taken inside the TUBE mostly looking terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) Next page...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN - a new SET OF FACES appears one by one on the screen. This time, STAR and KYLE are among them, next to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS touches the screen, two fingers, one on each of th kid's faces. THEIR IMAGES expand to fill the screen, side side, KYLE on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLE'S IMAGE, the date 10.16.18... the time, 22:19:23. word, in green: PROCESSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news. He'll soon be part of the network-- you'll be able to connect with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move to STAR'S IMAGE.       10.15.18... 22:20:49... and t in red: TERMINATED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERENA (cont'd) I'm sorry about the girl, Marcus. She didn't suffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus takes this in, his face shows pain. Then SERENA grasps his hand-- in moments, he's smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.     I... I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the building SHAKES, the sound of a distant EXPLOSION. SERENA releases MARCUS, listens in her earpiec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS (cont'd) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know-- I have to go.    Will you be all right? (off his smile and nod) Of course you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches him once more and moves off, leaving him alon here. We'll hear other far off EXPLOSIONS from time to ti during the following. MARCUS stares at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS FRIENDS' FACES, which slowly FADE TO BLACK, replaced his own REFLECTION. Seeing his own face, his smile vanish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS is going through a terrible internal struggle, the interface fighting his own natural emotions. He backs awa from the machine, looks around at the brains, all the liv destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurrying past the wall of brains, he moves a hand to the of his skull... with an ANGRY CRY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --his FINGERS dig into the plastic skin at the back of hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS grits his teeth, this is incredibly hard to do, bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --he RIPS THE INTERFACE MODULE from his skull-- CONNECTIO SPARK, we glimpse STEEL SKULL and the encased BRAIN benea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS hurls the DEVICE to the floor, its elaborate CIRCU SHATTERS. He reels with momentary anguish at what he's ju given up-- then he moves out of there with determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE and SMOKE in the distance, VEHICLES MOVING fast amid the destruction. It looks like the place is under attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS moves purposefully across the campus-- suddenly HEADLIGHTS illuminate him. He dives out of the way as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FUTURISTIC ATV roars past at high speed.   It's followe moments later by a massive SKYNET TANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS scrambles to his feet, continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PHYSICIST is SLAMMED against a wall. He never loses h unperturbed expression as MARCUS manhandles him. THE CLOC reads 01:05.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wormholing fluctuates, right now it's oscillating between three and six hours--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just breach the sphere. But you could materialize anywhere in a mile radius--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS tosses the man aside, regards the GLOWING, CRACKLI TIME SPHERE-- it doesn't look too inviting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR bursts open. SKELETAL TERMINATORS storm in, wielding PLASMA RIFLES-- they mean business--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PHYSICIST finally looks alarmed, getting in front of MARCUS as he yells--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHYSICIST (cont'd) No, don't shoot in here--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TERMINATOR FIRES anyway, BLOWING A HUGE HOLE through th center of the Physicist's chest and throwing him backward the floor-- the man looks down and shakes his head at the damage to his plastinated body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHYSICIST (cont'd) Idiots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECOND TERMINATOR spins his weapon on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --MARCUS, who LEAPS into the center of the sphere just as ROBOT FIRES and HITS nearby MACHINERY which EXPLODES--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENERGY ERUPTS around MARCUS, the CRACKLING BLUE LIGHT of time sphere surrounds him. We experience this from--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --INSIDE THE SPHERE. Marcus instinctively crouches in a FETAL POSITION. An instant later, his CLOTHING BURNS OFF FLESH. The HIGH TECH ENVIRONMENT around him TRANSFORMS in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAY WITH MARCUS-- FOLIAGE APPEARS around the SPHERE. The BLUE ENERGY fades, leaving him naked, 20 FEET IN THE AIR-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS PLUNGES to the ground and rolls.     He looks up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PLASTIC TREE has been melted with the heat like a can DRIPPING down around him.
